1.title: Dead Reckoning
1.plot: Tory and Robert explore the use of dead reckoning on their own mini-adventure. Discover what dead reckoning is in order to calculate the distance traveled in a single direction.

2.title: Planning Household Circuits
2.plot: Enid is planning her dream house, and Tony helps her plan for the electrical circuits needed.

3.title: The Speed of Light (Pilot)
3.plot: Tony and Enid discuss the consequences of the speed of light being constant.

4.title: The Future of Wind Energy
4.plot: Tony and Amaka discuss what it will take to reach the the US Department of Energy's wind energy goals.

5.title: Fishery Management
5.plot: Robert and Tory analyze how fisheries are managed using biomass and mortality data.

6.title: Real-world Recursion
6.plot: Tony and Enid look at examples of recursion in literature, nature, art, and music.

7.title: Bird Behavior
7.plot: Tory and Robert design an experiment to study bird's food-dropping behavior.

8.title: Comparing Growth Models
8.plot: Enid gives Tony and Amaka a choice between linear and exponential growth models.

9.title: The Golden Rectangle
9.plot: Robert and Tory look at the mysterious Golden Rectangle.

10.title: Tsunami
10.plot: Tony and Amaka discuss how tsunamis are created and what can make them destructive.

11.title: Retail Behavior
11.plot: Amaka and Tony study retail behavior differences between men and women.

1.title: Alamillo Bridge
1.plot: Learn about the different kinds of bridges that are out there with Enid and Tony. Discover how the varying designs use compression and tension.

2.title: Tiger
2.plot: Enid and Tory explore the differences between females and males in mammals. While tigers display obvious differences similar to humans, Enid and Tory discuss deductive reasoning and conjectures to see how accurate predictions are when it comes to a variety of mammals.

3.title: Squaring a Treehouse
3.plot: Tory and Robert become carpenters for the day as they prepare to build their dream tree house. Discover and watch the dynamic duo work and see why parallel lines and references are so essential to builders.

4.title: Revolving Door
4.plot: Michelle and Tony set out to investigate how rotational symmetry of revolving doors play a key role in the development of skyscrapers. Discover how air pressure affects how skyscrapers are built, and why revolving doors are an essential technology to have.

5.title: Hangglider Challenge
5.plot: Are you ready for the model hang glider challenge? The cast is in it to win it as they discover just how important it is to use triangle congruence in their models.

6.title: Building a Roof Truss
6.plot: Amaka and Robert explore the use of triangles and discover how trusses are essential in building because of their strength.

7.title: Diamonds
7.plot: Take a look with Tony at Enid's new diamond ring and see how complex diamonds truly are. What does the refractive index, reflected light and light dispersion have to do with diamonds? Let's Find out.

8.title: Scaling a Pool
8.plot: Discover how many different ways there are to scale a model as Enid and Tony explore the scales with a pool, as well as the scale model of a cube.

9.title: Finding the Height of a Rock Wall
9.plot: Go with Robert and Tory as they use an indirect method to determine the height of a wall. Watch the duo test the accuracy of two different measurement methods to see which one prevails.

10.title: Seismographs and Earthquake Epicenters
10.plot: Amaka and Tony provide data on earthquakes and how they are measured. Utilize trilateration to find the epicenters of historical earthquakes and discover whether or not they lie on known fault lines.

11.title: Population Density
11.plot: Take a look at the view with Enid and Amaka as they observe the big city. The duo will analyze the population density in various parts of Los Angeles with the help of a map and a lot of pennies.

1.title: Dirt Bike Trajectory
1.plot: Tory and Robert show how the use of simple algebra (and a parabola) can determine the trajectory of a dirt bike after it is launched off a ramp.

2.title: Solar Hot Dog Cooker
2.plot: Did you know that parabolic shapes can be used to focus energy? The cast take a look at their own parabolic invention to see how well sunlight can generate electricity.

3.title: Complex Numbers Made Real
3.plot: Amaka and Enid explore the use of complex and imaginary numbers to understand how imaginary numbers play a role in the context of electrical circuits.

4.title: Quonset Huts
4.plot: Come explore the history of Quonset Huts and Nissen Huts with Enid and Tony. Discover how these huts were utilized during World War II, and how their design can still be beneficial for building designs today.

5.title: The Heartbeat Hypothesis
5.plot: Tory and Enid take a trip to the zoo to study the lifespan of various animals. Through the use of the body mass hypothesis and heartbeat hypothesis, they discover how well you can predict an animal's lifespan. Think you know which animal at your zoo will live the longest? Let's find out.

6.title: Food Safety
6.plot: Enid and Robert are preparing for a picnic. They explain how the USDA uses Newton's Law of Cooling in order to follow safe cooking regulations based on time and temperature, and what you can do to prepare for your own bacteria-free picnic.

7.title: 3D Printing
7.plot: Amaka and Tony discuss and analyze how 3-D printers compare with traditional manufacturing on an economic level. In the end, are 3-D printers worth the cost?

8.title: LA River Ecology
8.plot: Robert and Tory go on a field trip to the LA River to explore the river's ecology. The two discuss how the river could be restored so that fish can return and thrive in the more environmentally friendly waters.

9.title: Parasailing to Great Heights
9.plot: Using terminal velocity, find out how high a para-sailer can go with Amaka and Robert as they sort through the information you need to know for your next para-sailing adventure.

10.title: Arborists
10.plot: Visit an arboretum at Cal Tech with Tony and Tory as they take a look at how to assess trees for diseases through different risk factors. After looking at all risk factors involved, numerical probability is assigned to find the treatment of a particular tree.

11.title: Volcano
11.plot: Take a look at the hazards associated with volcanoes with Amaka and Robert. Learn what kind of damage can occur after a volcanic eruption and how the information is collected.

imdb.title: Big Ideas
plot: A collection of STEM (Science Technology Engineering and Math) short films to help children relate STEM concepts to the environment in which they live.
